intro: Minuartia bulgarica, commonly known as the Bulgarian sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. It has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and its stems are often prostrate or ascending. Minuartia bulgarica is adapted to harsh climates and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience.
